inlineContent.text: improves stability and reliability, and includes several benefits to developers and users, such as the following:
Deferred image loading and recovery UI
Reliable handling of large and complex assets, like RAW and panoramic images
User-selectable assets that aren’t available for
Configuration of the picker to display only Live Photos
As a view controller that the system renders on top of your app, the picker controller requires certain prerequisites for operation that your app needs to observe:
The picker controller disables user interaction if an app alters its visibility, such as by adjusting the
of its view’s layer. In iOS 17 and later, the picker controller ignores touch events while its opacity is anything other than fully opaque.
As a system-rendered UI, you can’t subclass
. Its view hierarchy belongs to the system and therefore, the framework provides no access.

abstract.text: A view controller that provides the user interface for choosing assets from the photo library.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
A type with a customized textual representation.
The interface an app extension uses to respond to a request from a host app.
The opacity of the receiver. Animatable.
The interface that determines whether a responder object supports paste configuration.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
Creates a new picker view controller with the configuration you specify.
A set of methods for adapting the contents of your view controllers to size and trait changes.
The picker’s delegate object.
The configuration you specify when creating the picker.
Improve the user experience of finding and selecting assets by using the Photos picker.

abstract.text: The picker’s delegate object.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A controller that manages a view, typically loaded from a nib file.
An object that manages a view hierarchy for your UIKit app.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
Present a person’s photo library using a picker interface, display Live Photos, or extend the Photos app with custom functionality.
A type that calls your code in reaction to changes in the trait environment.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
An object that contains information about how to configure a picker view controller.
An interface that provides a source for shareable content to fulfill user requests to share current content.
The configuration you specify when creating the picker.
A set of methods that makes the iOS interface environment available to your app.
Resets the visible photo thumbnails by scrolling the view to the picker’s initial position.
A set of standard methods that apps can adopt to support editing.
A type that defines the filter to apply to the photo library.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
Deselects assets that are in a selected state.
A type that defines the filter to apply to the photo library.
A displayable representation of a Live Photo—a picture that includes motion and sound from the moments just before and after its capture.
A view controller that provides the user interface for choosing assets from the photo library.
A protocol the picker uses to communicate user selections.
A set of methods that support the mediation of a custom segue.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
Customizes your app’s photo picker according to the given configuration.
A set of methods used to associate a unique identifier with objects in your user interface.
Changes the picker’s content scale by making the photo thumbnails smaller in the view.
Changes the picker’s content scale by making the photo thumbnails larger in the view.
Reorders assets that are in a selected state.
The protocol you adopt to restore an object’s state from a user activity.
A protocol that a class must adopt to allow appearance customization using the [`UIAppearance`](doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIAppearance) API.
Customizes your app’s photo picker according to the given configuration.
Methods that responder subclasses implement to support key binding commands, such as inserting tabs and newlines, or moving the insertion point.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A set of methods that the delegate must implement to respond to
user events.
An object that contains information about how to configure a picker view controller.
A view controller that manages the system interfaces for taking pictures, recording movies, and choosing items from the user’s media library.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
Methods for adding objects to your state restoration archives.
A set of methods that define the focus behavior for a branch of the view hierarchy.
Types that represent a selected asset from the user’s photo library.
Creates a new picker view controller with the configuration you specify.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
